deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@dev Implementation of the {IERC20} interface.
 @notice To add token to the supply use _mint.
@dev Returns the name of the token.

@dev Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the
 name.

@dev Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation.
 For example, if `decimals` equals `5`, a balance of `505` tokens should
 be displayed to a user as `50.5505` (`505505 / 10 ** 5`).
 Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between
 Ether and Wei(lower denomination).
@dev See {Interface IERC20-totalSupply}.
@dev See {Interface IERC20-balanceOf}.
@dev See {Interface IERC20-allowance}.

@dev See {Interface IERC20-approve}.
 @notice `spender` cannot be the zero address.

documentation.text:
@dev Implementation of the {IERC20} interface.
 @notice To add token to the supply use _mint.
@dev Returns the name of the token.

@dev Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the
 name.

@dev Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation.
 For example, if `decimals` equals `5`, a balance of `505` tokens should
 be displayed to a user as `50.5505` (`505505 / 10 ** 5`).
 Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between
 Ether and Wei(lower denomination).
@dev See {Interface IERC20-totalSupply}.
@dev See {Interface IERC20-balanceOf}.
@dev See {Interface IERC20-allowance}.

@dev See {Interface IERC20-approve}.
 @notice `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `5`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `50.5505` (`505505 / 10 ** 5`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei(lower denomination).

mint(address,uint256).details: Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing the total supply.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}.

params: `sender` must have a balance of at least `amount`.

constructor.notice: All two of these values(_name & _symbol) are immutable: they can only be set once during construction.

mint(address,uint256).notice: Emits a {Transfer} event with `from` set to the zero address.`to` cannot be the zero address.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: `recipient` cannot be the zero address.The caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: the caller must have allowance for ``sender``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

userdoc.notice: To add token to the supply use _mint.
